definition: ovary (botany)
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
surname Fang
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Ovary culture of hybrid embryos was used at early phase and 128 seedlings were obtained successfully.
sentences.chinese: 通过对早期杂种胚胎的子房培养，获得128株小苗。

sentences.english: About 30% of spikelets possessed two or more ovaries .
sentences.chinese: 大约30%的颖花具有两个以上的子房。
子房和瘦果身体短柔毛。

sentences.english: The pathenocarpy relatived to the activities of POD and IAA oxidase.
sentences.chinese: 子房中两种酶的活性与幼果单果质量呈负相关。

sentences.english: It seems to join the billiard-room on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 它与弹子房相通，好像有意满足我们的需要似的。

sentences.english: When homework is assigned, do not moan or complain.
sentences.chinese: 老师抱怨迪克在弹子房鬼混，不做功课。

sentences.english: The ovary appears to have sunk into and fused with the cup-shaped receptacle.
sentences.chinese: 子房凹入杯状花托中并且与之合生。

sentences.english: The fertilized ovule becomes the seed , and the ovary becomes the fruit.
sentences.chinese: 已受精的卵子成为种子，而子房变成了果实。

sentences.english: Only the styles are left sticking up from the receptacle and ovary .
sentences.chinese: 在花托和子房上面只剩下花柱。

sentences.english: Sterile ovary globose, densely ferruginous villous.
sentences.chinese: 不育的子房球状，密被具铁锈色长柔毛。

sentences.english: Ovules attached to the walls of the ovary.
The ripened ovaries are small achenes on the surface of the receptacle, as in the strawberry.
sentences.chinese: 成熟子房为花托表面的小瘦果，如草莓。

sentences.english: We sit down in a billiard parlor on the Avenue du Maine and order hot Coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我们在梅园大道上一家弹子房中坐下要了热咖啡。

sentences.english: Cremocarp A dry fruit splitting into two one-seeded portions. The portions are termed mericarps.
sentences.chinese: 是由两个心皮的子房发育而成的干果。

definition: variant of 籽實|籽实[zi3 shi2]
a general planning in the seclusion of his tent is able to determine the outcome of the distant battle (idiom)

related.word: 运筹帷幄之中，决胜千里之外

definition: Xiao He (-193 BC), famous strategist and chancellor, fought on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]

Cao Can (-190 BC), second chancellor of Han Dynasty, contributed to its founding by fighting on Liu Bang's 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] side during the Chu-Han Contention 楚漢戰爭|楚汉战争[Chu3 Han4 Zhan4 zheng1]/also pr. [Cao2 Shen1]
ancient office title/rich and important person

the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
Li Wei Gong/Duke Li of Wei, official title of Li Jing 李靖[Li3 Jing4]
courtesy name of Zhuge Liang 諸葛亮|诸葛亮[Zhu1 ge3 Liang4]
Duke of Pei (i.e. 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1])
to brag/popular/lovely
Su Qin (340-284 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
Wu Guang (died 208 BC), Qin dynasty rebel, leader of the Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]
lit. fish bone of a minister (idiom); fig. person one can rely on for candid criticism
Chen Sheng (died 208 BC), Qin dynasty rebel, leader of the Chen Sheng Wu Guang Uprising 陳勝吳廣起義|陈胜吴广起义[Chen2 Sheng4 Wu2 Guang3 Qi3 yi4]
prime minister (in ancient China)
